items.title: Judge's 2 HRs fuel power show, rout of O's
items.summary: The Yankees scored six times in the first inning and Aaron Judge hit two homers as they coasted past the Orioles, 13-5, on Thursday night at Yankee Stadium.
items.content: The Yankees scored six times in the first inning and Aaron Judge hit two homers as they coasted past the Orioles, 13-5, on Thursday night at Yankee Stadium.

alternate.title: Judge's 2 HRs fuel power show, rout of O's

items.title: Valbuena says he'll continue to flip his bat
items.summary: Luis Valbuena said his bat flips have been a part of his game since he was a rookie, a habit generally meant to express his joy for baseball and to celebrate triumphs inside the batter's box. "I've done it all my life," Valbuena said. "It's natural to me." On Wednesday, Astros pitcher Mike Fiers took offense to it, and fired a ball over Valbuena's head.
items.content: Luis Valbuena said his bat flips have been a part of his game since he was a rookie, a habit generally meant to express his joy for baseball and to celebrate triumphs inside the batter's box. "I've done it all my life," Valbuena said. "It's natural to me." On Wednesday, Astros pitcher Mike Fiers took offense to it, and fired a ball over Valbuena's head.

alternate.title: Valbuena says he'll continue to flip his bat

items.title: Rosario, d'Arnaud exit with injuries vs. Cubs
items.summary: Mets shortstop Amed Rosario and catcher Travis d'Arnaud both left Thursday's game against the Cubs in the fifth inning due to injuries. Rosario departed with a tight right hip flexor after running gingerly out of the batter's box on a routine groundout, while d'Arnaud suffered a twisted right knee, according to the team.
items.content: Mets shortstop Amed Rosario and catcher Travis d'Arnaud both left Thursday's game against the Cubs in the fifth inning due to injuries. Rosario departed with a tight right hip flexor after running gingerly out of the batter's box on a routine groundout, while d'Arnaud suffered a twisted right knee, according to the team.

alternate.title: Rosario, d'Arnaud exit with injuries vs. Cubs

items.title: Keller leads Curve to Eastern League championship
items.summary: Led by ace Mitch Keller on the mound, the Altoona Curve completed their second straight postseason series sweep on Thursday as they defeated Trenton, 4-2, to claim the Double-A Eastern League title.
items.content: Led by ace Mitch Keller on the mound, the Altoona Curve completed their second straight postseason series sweep on Thursday as they defeated Trenton, 4-2, to claim the Double-A Eastern League title.

alternate.title: Keller leads Curve to Eastern League championship
